answers.answer: As long as there is not significant damage to the retina from those conditions, cataract surgery should have as favorable outcome as anyone else.  Not sure how to go about finding out who is good in the Philippines but asking around from other people who have had the surgery and from other doctors as well is a good idea.  You can also call the doctors in Manila and see if they recommend anyone in your province.HV

question: Hi Docs, thanks for your forum...helped me immensely 4 yrs ago when I was getting ready for my own surgeries and lens replacements...this question on behalf of 53 yrs old lady in the Philippines. She has cataracts and diabetes and hypertension.How long have these condiditons have been going on is unknown, perhaps for quite a while. She is being treated for the diabetes and BP. Best info I can get is "...sugar is 139...and blood still 160/90. Evidently they won't do anything about the cataracts until the diabetes high blood sugar is normalized.I researched a bit and see several abstracts of study results indicate cataract surgery in presence of diabetes has had good results with acceptable risks. Any info and opinions will be helpful...Lastly they have excellent docs and hospitals in Manila...don't know about the provinces, however. title: Cataract surgery in presence of diabetes and hypertension?
